diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis with necrosis of the fundus of the gallbladder and pericholecystic abscess.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain, fever, and leukocytosis. An ultrasound revealed multiple gallstones, a thickened gallbladder wall, and pericholecystic fluid, consistent with acute cholecystitis.
